name: *duplicate
description: Issue identified as a duplicate of another issue(s)

name: info-needed
description: Issue requires more information from poster

name: *caused-by-extension
description: Issue identified to be caused by an extension

name: insiders-released
description: Patch has been released in VS Code Insiders

name: *out-of-scope
description: Posted issue is not in scope of VS Code

name: *question
description: Issue represents a question, should be posted to StackOverflow (VS Code)

name: debug
description: Debug viewlet, configurations, breakpoints, adapter issues

name: *extension-candidate
description: Issue identified as good extension implementation

name: invalid
description: Issue identified as not relevant or not valid

name: feature-request
description: Request for new features or functionality

name: under-discussion
description: Issue is under discussion for relevance, priority, approach

name: *not-reproducible
description: Issue cannot be reproduced by VS Code Team member as described

name: candidate
description: Issue identified as probable candidate for fixing in the next release

name: engineering
description: VS Code - Build / issue tracking / etc.

name: electron
description: Issues and items related to Electron

name: upstream-issue-linked
description: This is an upstream issue that has been reported upstream

name: error-telemetry
description: VS Code - Issues generated by telemetry

description: VS Code crashing, performance, freeze and memory leak issues

description: Issues with VS Code on Linux

name: css-less-scss

name: accessibility
description: Keyboard, mouse, ARIA, vision, screen readers (non-specific) issues

description: Managing of editor widgets in workbench window

name: upstream
description: Issue identified as 'upstream' component related (exists outside of VS Code)

name: config
description: VS Code configuration, set up issues

name: web
description: Issues related to running VSCode in the web

name: bug

name: macos
description: Issues with VS Code on MAC/OS X

description: Issue/pull request mentioned in release notes

name: regression

description: VS Code - Next release plan for endgame

name: workbench-diagnostics

name: dropdown

name: *off-topic
